alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 5:02PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Custer County through 545 PM CDT... At 502 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mason City, or 24 miles southeast of Broken Bow, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ansley, Mason City, Westerville and Gavin Siding. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 90 and 92, and between mile markers 94 and 102. Highway 2 between mile markers 297 and 307. Highway 92 between mile markers 300 and 308. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
